primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The church (and the individual) must integrate moral passion (Torah piety) with the freedom of grace to achieve a 'whole' and 'prosperous' life that survives drought.

tekstueel_bewijs: We ourselves inevitably keep reenacting the Jerusalem dispute
we discover that elemental moral practice keeps life whole
how we act matters decisively for the future God will give us
These people keep reminding the church
James adds his footnote of moral passion
power for freedom and health has been unleashed in the world
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Subject (The one who must enact holiness)

tekstueel_bewijs: in this bread, we hear Torah as good news
Paul prevailed and set us on the catholic road
helper.rol_van_god: God is largely the 'Sender' or 'Object' of loyalty, rather than the active Subject.

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is seen as life's 'troubles' or 'wretchedness' which are countered by human 'elemental moral practice' rather than divine intervention.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The historical dispute between Paul and James regarding the Gentile mission.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Paul
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The historical victory of Paul (Grace) provides the 'lyric' or framework, but the primary program (James/Ethics) provides the 'staying power' for the hearer.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God is larger than Jewish scruple
God is more gracious and more dangerous
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we discover that elemental moral practice keeps life whole
we learn over and over that James has it right

voorbeelden: all must be guarded and attended to
Biblical faith has arisen out of moral passion
James knows that a false core loyalty will contaminate
power for freedom and health has been unleashed
elemental moral practice keeps life whole

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is driven by 'Obligation' (Devoir). It assumes that if the hearer knows (Savoir) the necessity of moral practice, they can (Pouvoir) perform it to survive the drought.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (James) to S1 (Paul) and then argues that S1 is insufficient without a return to S2 for 'staying power'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by making Grace the 'lyric' (aesthetic/theoretical) and Moral Passion the 'substance' (practical/survival).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 (Judgment/Moral Law) is treated as a protective boundary rather than a killing word.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: Despite the high praise for 'God’s unutterable free love,' the engine of the sermon is anthropocentric. Human 'enactment of holiness' is the cause of 'staying power' and 'wholeness.'

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: how we act matters decisively for the future God will give us
elemental moral practice keeps life whole

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Paul prevailed and set us on the catholic road of... God’s unutterable free love

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: James and Moses are used as models of 'moral passion' that the hearer must emulate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God preserves His church despite the legalism of James and the failures of Moses.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to maintain 'core loyalties' to avoid 'deathly sickness.'
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is dependent on the 'Secondary Program' (Ethics).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon struggles to reconcile the 'lyric of grace' with the 'footnote of law,' eventually subordinating grace to the utility of law.
spanning_punten: Grace is 'unutterable free love' vs. 'how we act matters decisively for the future God will give us.'

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Rooting life in massive obedience keeps one from being blown away.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon relies on human 'moral passion' rather than the Spirit's endowment of Pouvoir.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is viewed as 'distortion,' 'fraud,' or 'scruple' rather than a cosmic power requiring a Savior.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'Recruitment' narrative for moral discipline, using Grace as a decorative backdrop.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the Subject of 'keeping life whole.'
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: God as the Subject who plants the tree by the water.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: God plants us by the streams of water so that we might survive the drought.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Identify the hearer as the 'Gentile' who is 'turned to God' by God's own action.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Focus on Pouvoir (God's power given to the weak).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize how the 'unutterable free love' actually enables the life James desires.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: The radical inability of the human heart to maintain 'core loyalty.'
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Without a 'Heavy Opponent,' the 'Helper' (Grace) is merely a footnote.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's free love) must be the ground that makes Ethics possible, not the other way around.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has high rhetorical quality but requires a structural 'Subject-switch' to ensure the Gospel is the engine, not just the lyric.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is balanced; actantially, it is lopsided toward human agency.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis identifies the characters; semiotics reveals that 'James' is functioning as a Law-Sender.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Grace' is being used as a Modal Helper for a Human Subject, which is a structural hallmark of moralism.

appendices.notities: The sermon effectively 'recruits' the hearer to a lifestyle but fails to 'proclaim' a divine act.
